[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #280](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/280/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@markusweimer @jwang98052  This the IMRU driver code. You can give comments on code and all. Once Julia's pull request is merged I will debug it. However, I have done some bsic debugging by replacing generic map and update tasks with HelloREEF task and it works.

@jwang98052 @markusweimer 

I looked at the pull request. I am not very well aware with this part of the REEF so have only one comment at a meta-level: You have still retained the old APIs that take IConfiguration as input rather than string. Is there any reason for doing that? Are they used somewhere else also?

This pull request looks good
I didn't totally remove IConfiguration of task configuration form some APIs for pure Java clients. They don't need to use bridge and serialized configuration. They can use IConfiguratin directly.

I see...in that case pull request looks fine to me.

On Sun, Aug 9, 2015 at 11:08 PM, Julia Wang notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I didn't totally remove IConfiguration of task configuration form some
> APIs for pure Java clients. They don't need to use bridge and serialized
> configuration. They can use IConfiguratin directly.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/355#issuecomment-129317443
> .
@dafrista Thank you for the comment. I addressed it.

All except one of the changes were automated with `change_version.py` at #331.

The manual change was setting the snapshot number in `build.props` to `00`. Does this match the correct numbering scheme?

This looks good. I will test, merge, and upload to the website.
(Off topic, github has a nice image diff tool.)

@dongjun-Lee I left one comment.

Otherwise, the script works well. I tested on Linux with `MESOS_NATIVE_LIBRARY` set (works well) and unset (finds the library and works well) and Mac with no Mesos (fails well).

> (Off topic, github has a nice image diff tool.)

Yes, I thought the same when I looked at it. Awesome stuff :-)
looking at it..
@dkm2110 I did a pass.
I'll do a pass, but we need a pass by @beysims for the interop bits.
@afchung I'm done with my syntax level review.
